techmeme.title: A US congressional spokesperson says UAE scuttled meetings this month between congressional staff and G42 after the US raised concerns about Microsoft-G42 deal (Alexandra Alper/Reuters)
Following Google's announcement of plans to keep cookies, W3C says third-party cookies must be removed as this invisible tracking "hurts everyone's privacy" (Hadley Beeman/W3C)
Meta releases Segment Anything Model 2 with support for object segmentation in videos and images; the code and weights are available under an Apache 2.0 license (Devin Coldewey/TechCrunch)
Meta rolls out AI Studio in the US, letting users create and share AI chatbots, and Instagram creators set up chatbots to answer DM questions and story replies (Karissa Bell/Engadget)
Twitch rolls out a revamped iOS and Android app, which now shows a TikTok-like feed of recommended content when it's opened, instead of a "Following" list (Jay Peters/The Verge)
